title: We Can Make Sounds
subtle: Descriptive (nonfiction), 40 words, Level A (Grade K), Lexile BR70L
description: Kids can make all kinds of sounds with their bodies--from a clap to a pop. Patterned sentences and photographs guide the reader through some of the sounds a child can make without ever even having to pick up a musical instrument.
meta: clap, pop, slap, snap, sounds, tap
Use the reading strategy of self-monitoring to understand text
Consonants : Identify words that end with the /p/ sound
Onomatopoeia : Understand that some words sound like their meaning

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
